title: Tracky
description: Got inspired by Flighty and decided to build a clone for trains (Amtrak).

title: Tryflux.ai
description: Selected as 1/6 of 1000+ applicants for the Photon Residency program. Built tryFlux.ai in a month with co-residents, generating 1M+ in views across social media and subproducts (Epstein.im).

title: Cow Farm Simulator
description: Rebuilding Scratch game from my childhood. One of my favorite ongoing projects.

title: Bullhorn Aerosystems
description: Building open-source alternative to Gotham by Palantir. Originally written as a 3D engine for ATC simulations & trainings.

title: Linge
description: Built as if Tinder & Hinge had a baby. Swipe on your coffee chat matches.

title: Browserbase Clone
description: Wrote a clone of Browserbase with GPT-4 using screenshots instead of Selenium before Browserbase migrated to a hybrid approach. Written as a Chrome extension — was faster than most web models at the time.

title: NORMA
description: I built an open-source mocap software for exporting pose-tracked data for anything from surfing pose review to video game character animations. Now used & maintained by University of Pennsylvania research staff under Professor Rajapakse for injury recovery.

title: YC AI Startup School Search
description: Built a vector-embedded repository for YCombinator AI Startup School data (speaker transcripts & chat logs). Launched on LinkedIn to 300k+ views, 500+ registered users, and 1M+ vector queries (100k~ searches).

title: Iron Empire
description: Built a train game that cloned my childhood favorite (中华铁路 on QQ). Implemented 4 types of trains with differing stats and infinite purchasable stations.

title: Moonbeam
description: What if you had a clear path to your dream career? I built a tool allowing you to search up your dream job and orchestrated a timeline on how to get there based on what your school's alumni have done in your situation.

title: Poke
description: Software where you can connect with (or poke) your friends based on shared physical proximity and calendar availabilities.
